dmca.title: MetroGuide.com Asks Google to Remove Links (#4)
dmca.body:
MetroGuide.com
[private]
Hollywood, FL  33021
Tel: xxx-xxx-xxxx
Fax: xxx-xxx-xxxx

May 12, 2004

Via Federal Express
Google, Inc.
Attn: Customer Support, DMCA Complaints
[private]
Mountain View, CA 94043

Re: 		Notice of Copyright Infringing Websites

Dear Google Customer Support:

I am writing this letter in compliance with Google's Copyright Policy due to the publication and promotion of websites that we believe, in good faith, has infringed our copyrighted work. Moreover, as the copyright owner, we can confirm that the third party use is not authorized by us, the copyright owner, our agents, or the law.

The websites, http://www.browardconventioncenter.com/events.htm, 
http://www.downtowndiscovery.com/info/annual.htm, 
http://www.markschweizer.com/local/annual.htm, 
http://www.orlandosbest.net/events.htm, 
http://www.aaatop20orlandohoteldeals.com/orlando%20events.htm, 
http://www.miamitravelinformation.com/miami_event_april.html, 
http://www.miamitravelinformation.com/miami_events_march.html, 
http://www.miamitravelinformation.com/miami_events_feb.html, 
http://www.miamitravelinformation.com/miami_events_jan.html, 
http://www.miamigaytravel.com/activities.htm, 
http://www.travelpackflorida.com/attractions/at-miami.html, 
http://www.miamihotelsearch.com/todoinmiami.html, 
http://www.miami-guide.com/Art/museums.htm, and 
http://www.businesscycles.com/velofax_02collegiate.htm have engaged in egregious conduct by stealing virtually all of the copyrighted content from our sites, http://fort.lauderdale.eventguide.com/annual_events_overview.html, http://orlando.eventguide.com/annual_events_overview.html 
http://miami.eventguide.com/annual_events_overview.html, and http://attractionguide.com/miami, and http://fort.lauderdale.hotelguide.net/ word for word. For your convenience, I am including a booklet that provides (1) proof of our copyrighted work, see Tab "1," (2) a copy of our webpages from which the content was stolen, see Tab "2," (3) copies of the infringing websites, side-by-side comparisons of the webpages, Google search results listing the infringing sites, and a WHOIS Search Results listing for the domain names, see Tab
